page.title: 04INDUSTRY SHELL OIL WOODSTOCK
page.content: In 1945 Shell established a research centre on the site of Woodstock Farm and a 180 hectares of surrounding land. Kent was chosen because there are lots of orchards which allow their scientists to test chemical pesticides. The site has 16 glass houses to store the plants after they have been sprayed,and experiments take 8 to 10 years to complete.It is essential to take this long to ensure that the pesticides will not harm people, wildlife and the crops themselves.680 people are employed and 6 000 guests visit the site every year.Woodstock club is a part of Shell research and has football,cricket,tennis,bowls and squash facilities for the workers.
